text: In the house of a wealthy merchant in Mexico City, surrounded by comforts and all kinds of machines, lived not long ago a Dog who had been put into his head to become a human being, and he worked hard on this. After several years, and after persistent efforts on his own, he walked easily on two legs and sometimes felt that he was about to be a man, except for the fact that he did not bite, moved his tail when he met someone he knew, made three laps before going to bed, spat when he heard the church bells, and at night he climbed up a barbed moaning looking long at the moon. FIN
title: El perro que deseaba ser un ser humano
author: Augusto Monterroso
